title: Explanatory vs. Response Variable
question_text:
Loading question supplement...
In a research study, observers are investigating the performance of a professional hockey team. The scatter plot above shows the average number of hours spent practicing in a week and the number of goals scored in a season. Which of the following statements is true about the variables for this scenario?

choices.text: The number of hours spent practicing is the response variable, and the number of goals scored in a season is the explanatory variable.
The number of hours spent practicing is the explanatory variable, and the number of goals scored in a season is the response variable.
Both the number of hours spent practicing and the number of goals scored in a season are explanatory variables.
Both the number of hours spent practicing and the number of goals scored in a season are response variables.
There is no explanatory or response variable in this scenario.
